description.narrative:
Diaspora youth organizations seek to facilitate the integration of the youth in their host communities in an effort to build vibrant, secure and cohesive communities. Any activity or project carried out by the youth diaspora organisations to promote integration should ensure that it engages both the native and migrant communities in a position that encourages mutual responsibility, participation and mutual benefits to the society as a whole. Various organisations most notably the African Diaspora Youth Network in Europe (ADYNE) and the United Nations Alliance of Civilizations (UNAOC) have held various seminars and programs with the main objective of promoting dialogue between different youth organisations. This is done with the main aim of promoting better integration of young migrants into European societies. The bridge project funded by the European commission aims at preventing situations of prejudice and self-discrimination by improving their social competences, in particular communication skills (bridge, 2010). More training should beprovided by the youth organisations to youth in the diaspora in an effort to better their access to the labour market and personal development. As acknowledged by the European commission, successful integration of migrants both young and old is the key to maximizing opportunities in both the host country and the country of origin (European commission, 2012).
DFD is a young Diaspora Platform,existing 4 years. On top of this, organizations vary in their thematic focus and projects. Thus, on one hand, there is a need to improve its organizational cohesiveness; and on the other hand, DFD must be able to push forward its collective agenda. It is therefore imperative that DFD initiates participatory approach in leveling off knowledge and expertise to achieve a collective agenda thathas broad-based support from its constituencies.
This initiative is a good example on setting up a structural instrument for the strategic engagement of Diaspora youths, better understanding and lessons from most successful initiatives carried out by youth-led and youth facilitating organisations will be provided to involve them within the Diaspora organizations.
By supporting the initiative of the Diaspora, just like the network or the platform of the Diaspora, Oxfam Novib would be again seen and recognized as an organization that supports migrant organizations. Diaspora platform are important for Oxfam Novib to come in contact with the migrants in the Netherlands and to help them to lobby for their work.

participating-org.narrative:
As could be seen in the presentation of DFD’s (Diaspora Forum for Development) work for the past 5 years, DFD has proven to be effective as a focal point for collective lobby undertaken by the various diaspora organizations seeking attention for the Diaspora’s role in the development discourse. From the capability-building activities (trainings, exposure visits, linking & learning conferences) sponsoredby Oxfam Novib, It has also been able to access additional capability building support for project design & management from MinBuza, and explore possibilities of partnerships with Dutch, European and other global stakeholders. Oxfam Novib has been supporting DFD since 2009 and DFD got stronger and could lobby and campaign for the involvement of the Diaspora.
DFD has 45 members and most of them are very active and strong migrant organization. The board members of DFD have the skills to undertake the planned activities to achieve their goals. Ministry of Foreign Affairs and other NGO’s are interested in the work of DFD and they have been invited for several meetings. DFD even got in 2011 an grant of 100.000 Euro from MinBuza, this was an achievement that DFD could reach with the support of Oxfam Novib. DFD is now an official partner and the support from Oxfam Novib will make them only stronger.DFD also became a partner (with several organisations) in several projects in fouryears time and they have been coordinating well, because of this it is clear that they have the capacity to be involved in some other initiatives in the near future.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to social and political participation
